item.title: Deobfuscating a JS Malware Loader
item.description: I’ve been collecting malware samples for quite some time and decided to try deobfuscating and reversing one to understand what it does. The sample I’ve chosen is one PAY75173152798.js (0dde38d34e4ddd5b43cbfe6aa52db911), a malicious file that is delivered as a file attachment in an email. I do not have a copy of the email this sample was originally attached with, but judging by the name I assume it would pretend to be an invoice or receipt.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello World This is my first blog post, and also my first time using Hugo! I’m using MarkText to draft this post, and I feel pretty comfortable with Markdown after using Obsidian quite a while for taking notes.
